awards.title: Delta Mu Delta Honour Society U.S.
awards.description:
Faculty from New York University, Harvard, and Yale founded Delta Mu Delta in 1913 to promote scholarship in training for business and to recognize and reward scholastic achievement. Today, Delta Mu Delta is one of the highest levels of national recognition a business student can earn.

Membership in Delta Mu Delta is open only to students at colleges and universities with business programs accredited by the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP). Webster's chapter, Lambda Kappa, is open to Business and Management program undergraduates and candidates for the baccalaureate degree who have completed at least one-half of the work required for the degree with a cumulative average grade record of 3.70, or better, and who are in the top 20 percent of their college class in cumulative average grades; and to graduate and doctoral students who have completed at least 27 credit hours of the work required for their degree with a cumulative average grade record of 3.95, or better, and who are in the top 20 percent of their college class in cumulative average grades.

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the project development and execution for Tata Steel IJmuiden. Leading a diverse team of approx. 120 FTE to deliver the capital expenditure plan.

profile_positions.description:
HPM (Hydraulics, Pneumatics & Utilities) is an engineering department of PTC (Projects, Technical & Consultancy) which belongs to Engineering & Site Services of Tata Steel IJmuiden.

HPM department consists of project engineers and technical specialists who are responsible for mono- and multi-disciplinary work packages in the area of hydraulics, pneumatics and utilities (piping, static and rotating equipment).

As Technical Manager, I am responsible for the strategy of the department and the continuously development of the department and the individual engineers and specialists.

Furthermore, I am also responsible for:
- Determining and mobilizing the right resources (project engineers and specialist) to the right project, including their performance.
- Developing, promoting and enforcing the knowledge to project teams and end-users (factories on IJmuiden site)
- And contribute to structural improvement of installations and/or factories.

In addition, I am (as Technical Manager) also the chairman of the Oxygen Committee and Hydraulics Community.

profile_positions.description:
KNPC (Kuwait National Petroleum Company) new Al Zour Refinery (Package 2 - Support Process Units and Package 3 - Off-Sites and Infrastructure) Project.

Material availability is one of the key factors/drivers for a successful project. As JV Material Control Manager, I am responsible for timely availability of Material Take Offs (mainly Pipe, Electrical & Instrumentation bulk materials) with sufficient quantities for purchasing. Furthermore, I am responsible for a timely availability of IFC Documents (e.g. Isometrics, Cable Schedules) with sufficient quality to ensure that Field Material Management is able to release the right materials to the right contractor.

My primary responsibilities are:
1) Development and implementation of Material Take-Off procedures & work processes for Electrical & Instrumentation bulk materials
2) Support JV Engineering Management to ensure that all available tools (e.g. S3D, SPEL and SPI) are fully utilized to secure the quality of MTO's and IFC Documents
3) Share my Lessons Learned (Material Planning & Control) from KNPC MAB2 Project with KNPC ZOR Project, which includes improvements strategies & ideas
profile_positions.title: JV Material Control Manager

profile_positions.description:
KNPC (Kuwait National Petroleum Company) Clean Fuels (MAB2) Project.

As JV Material Planning Manager, I am responsible for oversight of the entire project material life cycle, to ensure the right material is in the right place (e.g. Construction Site, Prefabrication Shops) at the right time (supporting the Construction activities, with a minimal level of surplus.

My primary responsibilities are:
1) Development and implementation of Material Planning plan and participation in the development of the Discipline (e.g. Piping, Electrical and Instrumentation) Material Control Plan
2) Set-up the Material Planning & Control Team in our New Delhi and Amsterdam Offices
3) Establish interfaces with Engineering, Procurement, Field Material Management and Construction
4) Define reporting requirements to support the project. This includes the complete system set-up in Material Manager (MatMan), databases and other reporting tools.
5) Establish interfaces with Piping Prefabrication Shops and Structural Steel Suppliers

Project portfolio assignment: JV Risk Manager. This portfolio includes internal (within the Joint-Venture) and external (with the Client) risk management
profile_positions.title: JV Material Planning Manager

profile_positions.description:
New chemical complex comprising 9 process units and associated U&O.

Area Project Manager tasks includes scope control, schedule, cost and risk. Besides the day -to-day execution actvities, I have two project portfolio assignments: Change Management & Procurement.
I strongly believe that relationship management with both Client and Fluor project teams will support the execution of a successful project. Besides relationship management, strong leadership and a clear strategy will support this also
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Conversion of an empty gas reservoir into a gas storage facility involves modification of an existing well site to accommodate 14 new wells, as well as construction of a new gas treatment plant with injection and treatment facilities; Fluor is providing EPCM services.

- Overall responsible for all Project Controls activities (internal & external financials, manpower planning, schedules, progress measurement, change management, key quantities, internal & external risk management, internal & external reporting etc), including Class 2 Estimate and the development & maintaining baseline documents.
- Participate in progress meeting with major vendors
- Participate in negotiation meetings with Contractors and progress meetings
profile_positions.title: Project Controls Manager

profile_positions.description:
Fluor provided FEED and EPCM services to relocate a fully continuous integrated chemical and polymer compounding facility producing polyoxymethylene (POM), increasing the capacity from 110 kt/yr to 140 kt/yr.

As Project Control Manager on the TiGer project, I am responsible for business management, cost management and planning. Some examples of these activities:
- Involvement in the developing of the execution plan
- Development of the progress systems with respect to cost, cash flow, progress, key quantity, manpower and efficiency for both Home Office and Construction.
- Challenge and analyze the input (planned, actual and forecasted figures with respect to manpower, progress and cost) from Fluor disciplines and (sub)contractors during the engineering and construction phase.
- Analyze the status of the project with respect to progress and cost and develop mitigation plans when necessary.
- Review the monthly progress report (cost, progress and schedule) with the client and Fluor management (these reviews are held separately from each other).
profile_positions.title: Project Controls Manager

profile_positions.description:
Fluor conducted the study and performed engineering, procurement, and construction management of a large program consolidating three refineries into two sites. 

I developed myself from planner to lead engineer Planning (EPC) during the project. I started in home office (Haarlem) and after 6 months I moved to site. I developed, maintained, statussed and analysed all kind of schedules, such as:
- PMS Level 1 schedules for new and revamps units
- Level 2 Procurement schedules
- Level 2 Engineering schedules for new and revamp units
- Level 2 Construction schedules for new and revamp units
- High Level Turn Around schedules for revamp units
- High Level Pre-commissioning (Turn Over System schedules for new units
Furthermore I did the weekly construction progress calculation and the daily construction Turn Around progress
